title: How to Cope.
content:
Always be prepared! 
1. Keep track of when your periods are due so that you are not caught by surprise. 
2. Avoid eating too much salt because salt causes your body to retain extra water especially around the time of your periods. 
3. Drink plenty of warm water.  
4. Exercise, exercise, exercise                                                                                                                        

What to use: With or without money, you can deal with your periods just fine. You can use clean cotton clothes, toilet tissue, pads, or tampons. However, you need to change these frequently to avoid staining and bad smells. 

For more information, SMS to 6300 or visit a Straight Talk Youth Centre in your area.
